content:
From: JS Lemay <js.lemay@mq.edu.au>

From: Francis Borceux <francis.borceux@uclouvain.be>
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 5:51:45 PM (UTC+10:00) Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney
To: Categories mailing list
Subject: Rosanna Cruciani

It is with sadness that I let the categorical community know that Rosanna Cruciani passed this week-end.

She has been a prominent figure of category theory in Rome. She was a reliable mathematician, a highly friendly person … and a very good cook. Her hospitality has always been very generous.

We shall miss her. Our great sympathy goes to her daughter Raffaella and her son Giovanni.

Her funerals will take place this Tuesday 31 at 9.30 in the church Nostra Signora di Coromoto in Rome.

Francis Borceux

From: JS Lemay <js.lemay@mq.edu.au>

From: Marco Grandis <grandis@dima.unige.it>
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 6:57:31 PM (UTC+10:00) Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney
To: Categories mailing list
Subject: Re: Rosanna Cruciani

It’s very sad, we are missing a dear colleague and a wonderful person

Marco Grandis

From: JS Lemay <js.lemay@mq.edu.au>

From: Ross Street <ross.street@mq.edu.au>
Sent: Monday, October 30, 2023 9:36:47 PM (UTC+10:00) Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney
To: Francis Borceux
Cc: Categories mailing list
Subject: Re: Rosanna Cruciani

Dear Francis

I am very sad to hear that news. Rosanna Succi Cruciani was a regal woman. She and her husband were very kind to us when I, with family, were in Rome in 1981.

Please convey my sympathy and respect to her family.

Ross

Sent from my iPhone

On 30 Oct 2023, at 5:53 pm, Francis Borceux <francis.borceux@uclouvain.be> wrote:

﻿
It is with sadness that I let the categorical community know that Rosanna Cruciani passed this week-end.

We shall miss her. Our great sympathy goes to her daughter Raffaella and her son Giovanni.

Francis Borceux
